body:
Comment 1: 
Sorry this tripped you up. 

There's a tension here between the principle of least surprise and making "go get
code.google.com/p/go.tools/cmd/godoc" just Do The Right Thing for most people. Remember
that most people will go install godoc just because they want the latest version of
goodc, and would expect it to replace their existing version of godoc.

Trying to think of a way to make this more obvious. A warning is one answer, and maybe
the right one. If that's the case, we should do it for the other tools (vet, cover) that
get installed to $GOROOT/pkg/tool/.
